title: Linux ftpcount Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the ftpcount command in Linux, which allows you to monitor and count active FTP sessions on your system. Learn how to install, use, and interpret the output of this useful network utility.

meta.title: Linux ftpcount Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the ftpcount command in Linux, which allows you to monitor and count active FTP sessions on your system. Learn how to install, use, and interpret the output of this useful network utility.
meta.keywords: Linux, ftpcount, FTP, network monitoring, session count, system administration

verify.name: Verify ftpcount installation
verify.hint: The ftpcount command could not be found. Please verify the installation by running 'sudo apt-get install -y ftpcount' again.

steps.title: Use ftpcount to Count FTP Sessions

verify.name: Verify ftpcount session count
verify.hint: The ftpcount command did not report 1 active FTP session as expected. Please check your FTP server setup and try running ftpcount again.

steps.title: Analyze ftpcount Output and Understand Session Details

verify.name: Verify ftpcount session details
verify.hint: The ftpcount output did not match the expected details. Please check your FTP server setup and try running ftpcount again.
